question: What was the name of the ancient Egyptian pharaoh who built the Great Pyramid?
funFact: Khufu (also known as Cheops) was the pharaoh who built the Great Pyramid of Giza around 2560 BC. It's the largest of the three pyramids.

question: What was the name of the ancient Egyptian queen who was the last pharaoh?
funFact: Cleopatra VII was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt. She ruled from 51-30 BC and had relationships with both Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

question: What was the name of the ancient West African empire known for its gold?
funFact: The Ghana, Mali, and Songhai empires were all powerful West African empires known for their gold trade. The Mali Empire's Mansa Musa was one of the wealthiest people in history.

question: What was the name of the East African trading city?
funFact: Kilwa was a major East African trading city on the Swahili Coast. It was a center of trade between Africa, Arabia, India, and China.

question: What was the name of the ancient Ethiopian kingdom?
funFact: Axum was an ancient Ethiopian kingdom that flourished from the 1st to the 8th century AD. It was one of the four great powers of the ancient world.

question: What was the name of the slave trade that devastated Africa?
funFact: The Atlantic, Trans-Saharan, and Indian Ocean slave trades all devastated Africa. The Atlantic Slave Trade alone transported 12-15 million Africans to the Americas.

question: What was the name of the European colonization of Africa?
funFact: The Scramble for Africa (1881-1914) was the rapid colonization of Africa by European powers. By 1914, almost all of Africa was under European control.

question: What was the name of the South African system of racial segregation?
funFact: Apartheid was a system of racial segregation in South Africa from 1948 to 1994. It was ended by Nelson Mandela and the African National Congress.

question: What was the name of the South African leader who fought against apartheid?
funFact: Nelson Mandela (1918-2013) was a South African anti-apartheid revolutionary who became the first black president of South Africa. He spent 27 years in prison.

question: What was the name of the Ethiopian emperor who modernized the country?
funFact: Haile Selassie (1892-1975) was the last emperor of Ethiopia. He modernized the country and was a symbol of African independence.

question: What was the name of the Algerian War of Independence?
funFact: The Algerian War of Independence (1954-1962) was a war between France and Algerian nationalists. Algeria gained independence in 1962.

question: What was the name of the Kenyan independence leader?
funFact: Jomo Kenyatta (c. 1897-1978) was the first president of independent Kenya. He led the country to independence from Britain in 1963.

question: What was the name of the Ghanaian independence leader?
funFact: Kwame Nkrumah (1909-1972) was the first prime minister and president of Ghana. He led Ghana to independence in 1957, making it the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence.

question: What was the name of the Rwandan genocide?
funFact: The Rwandan Genocide (1994) was a mass slaughter of Tutsi and moderate Hutu by Hutu extremists. An estimated 800,000 to 1 million people were killed in 100 days.

question: What was the name of the ancient city in Zimbabwe?
funFact: Great Zimbabwe was an ancient city in Zimbabwe that flourished from the 11th to the 15th century. It was the capital of the Kingdom of Zimbabwe.

question: What was the name of the ancient trading city in Mali?
funFact: Timbuktu was a major trading and learning center in the Mali Empire. It was famous for its universities and libraries and was a center of Islamic scholarship.

question: What was the name of the ancient Nubian kingdom?
funFact: Kush was an ancient Nubian kingdom that existed from around 1070 BC to 350 AD. It was a powerful kingdom that even conquered Egypt for a time.

question: What was the name of the Zulu kingdom?
funFact: The Zulu Kingdom (1816-1897) was a powerful kingdom in southern Africa. It was founded by Shaka Zulu and was known for its military prowess.

question: What was the name of the ancient Egyptian pharaoh who tried to establish monotheism?
funFact: Akhenaten (c. 1353-1336 BC) tried to establish monotheism in ancient Egypt by worshiping only the sun god Aten. His religious reforms were reversed after his death.

question: What was the name of the African independence movements?
funFact: The African independence movements (1950s-1970s) saw most African countries gain independence from European colonial powers. This period is known as the 'Year of Africa.'
